title: Birman–Wenzl algebra
summary: In mathematics, the Birman–Murakami–Wenzl (BMW) algebra, introduced by Joan Birman and Hans Wenzl (1989) and Jun Murakami (1987), is a two-parameter family of algebras C n ( ℓ , m ) {\displaystyle \mathrm {C} _{n}(\ell ,m)} of dimension 1 ⋅ 3 ⋅ 5 ⋯ ( 2 n − 1 ) {\displaystyle 1\cdot 3\cdot 5\cdots (2n-1)} having the Hecke algebra of the symmetric group as a quotient.  It is related to the Kauffman polynomial of a link. It is a deformation of  the Brauer algebra in much the same way that Hecke algebras are deformations of the group algebra of the symmetric group.
